This manual describes version &appversion; of &app;

section.title: Introduction
section.para: The &app; application allows you to play classic coin-operated arcade games on your GNOME desktop using the Multiple Arcade Machine Emulator (MAME).

listitem.para: Play classic arcade games on your desktop.
Tag your favorite games to easily find them again later.
Read historical information and tips about your favorite games.

section.title: Starting &app;
section.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para: To start &app; from a command line, type the following command, then press Return:

tip.para: To view other command line options that are available, type gnome-video-arcade --help, then press Return.

section.title: When You Start &app;
section.para: The first time you start &app;, it will build a database of game information and determine which games are available. This process may take several minutes to complete, during which time the following window is displayed:

mediaobject.textobject: Shows &app; main window while the database is being built. Most of the elements are grayed out, and a progress bar is shown at the bottom.

section.para: The window will then change to look like this:

mediaobject.textobject: Shows &app; main window with a sample list of games. Contains menubar, game list, view buttons, start game button, properties button and statusbar.

section.para: You may see a different list of games, depending on which ROM images are installed on your system.

note.para: Occasionally, the database may be rebuilt when you start &app;. Most of the time it will skip this process and go straight to the window in Figure 2.

section.para: The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands you need to use in &app;.
The game list displays a list of games to choose from.
The view buttons control which games are displayed in the game list. You can choose between displaying all available games, a list of your favorite games, or the results of your last search.
The Start Game button starts the highlighted game in the game list.
The Properties button displays additional information about the highlighted game in the game list.
The statusbar displays the MAME version used to play games and contextual information about the menu items. It also displays a progress bar while building the game database.

section.title: To Start a Game
section.para:
Choose a game from the game list and click on it to highlight it. Then click the Start Game button or choose
Ctrl S
Game Start .

tip.para: You can also start a game by double-clicking on it in the game list.

section.title: To View Properties of a Game
section.para:
Chose a game from the game list and click on it to highlight it. Then click the Properties button or choose
Ctrl P
View Properties .

The Properties dialog displays information about the highlighted game, including some history about the game, tips and tricks to help improve your scores, pictures of the arcade cabinet, screen shots of the game in progress and some technical information about MAME's emulation of the game.
To close the Properties dialog, click the Close button.

note.para: Some of these features are not yet completed and will be available in a future version of &app;.

section.title: To Tag a Game as a Favorite
section.para:
To tag a game as a favorite, choose a game from the game list and click on it to highlight it. Then choose
Ctrl +
Game Add to Favorites . The heart icon for the highlighted game will light up to indicate that the game has been added to your list of favorites.

If you decide the game is no longer a favorite, click on the game in the game list to highlight it. Then choose
Ctrl -
Game Remove from Favorites . The heart icon for the hightlighted game will turn gray to indicate that the game has been removed from your list of favorites.
section.tip: You can also click directly on a heart icon in the game list to tag the game as a favorite or not a favorite.
